titleStmt.title: To the supream authority of England, the Parliament assembled, the scope of the humble remembrance of that prodigious conspiracy, called the bloody petition, to be humbly presented by David Brown and his family, as discoverers thereof, besides, many other discoveries and faithful services: whereunto is annexed, their humble petition for assistance towards the repairing of certain wrongs, done unto them by Lieutenant Colonel John Lilborn, Samuel Chidley, John Musgrave, and some others.
titleStmt.author: Brown, David, fl. 1650-1652.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by John Field, printer to the Parliament of England,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "January 22." Thomason supplied the "2" in the imprint date.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
